intro: Duma coccoloboides, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Duma coccoloboides plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is a symbol of Hawaii's unique biodiversity.
